title: OSX Install instructions are incomplete on ElCap
body:
### What did you do?

Upgraded to ElCap, which blew away a functioning homebrew system on Mavericks. Upgraded XCode, launched, agreed to license. Brew installed dependencies and python 2/3. (and as an aside, virtualenv isn't working out of the box, but not our problem)

On Master, ran `make install` and it died looking for the zlib headers.

`brew install libtiff libjpeg webp little-cms2 python python3`
### What actually happened?

```
(vpy27)Erics-MacBook-Air:Pillow erics$ python setup.py build_ext --debug
running build_ext
Appending path /Users/erics/Pillow/libImaging
Appending path /Users/erics/vpy27/lib
Appending path /Users/erics/vpy27/include
Appending path /usr/local/lib
Appending path /usr/local/include
Appending path /opt/X11/lib
Appending path /opt/X11/include
Appending path /usr/lib
Looking for zlib
Checking for include file zlib.h in /Users/erics/Pillow/libImaging

Looking for tiff

Looking for freetype

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup.py", line 753, in <module>
    zip_safe=not debug_build(), )
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.11/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/distutils/core.py", line 151, in setup
    dist.run_commands()
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.11/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py", line 953, in run_commands
    self.run_command(cmd)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.11/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py", line 972, in run_command
    cmd_obj.run()
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.11/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/distutils/command/build_ext.py", line 339, in run
    self.build_extensions()
  File "setup.py", line 521, in build_extensions
    ' using --disable-%s, aborting' % (f, f))
ValueError: zlib is required unless explicitly disabled using --disable-zlib, aborting
```
### What versions of Pillow and Python are you using?

Homebrew python 2.7.11
